tool.name: align seqs
tool.description: Align sequences using a variety of alignment methods
tool.command:
align_seqs.py -i $input_fasta_fp
#if str($alignment_method) != 'None': -m $alignment_method #end if
#if str($pairwise_alignment_method) != 'None': -a $pairwise_alignment_method #end if
#if str($template_fp) != 'None': -t $template_fp #end if
#if $min_length: -e $min_length #end if
#if $min_percent_id: -p $min_percent_id #end if
-o align_seqs_output

param.label: -i/--input_fasta_fp: path to the input fasta file
param.name: input_fasta_fp

param.label: -m/--alignment_method: Method for aligning sequences. Valid choices are: pynast, infernal, clustalw, muscle, infernal, mafft [default: pynast]
param.name: alignment_method

param.label: -a/--pairwise_alignment_method: method for performing pairwise alignment in PyNAST. Valid choices are muscle, pair_hmm, clustal, blast, uclust, mafft [default: uclust]
param.name: pairwise_alignment_method

param.label: -e/--min_length: Minimum sequence length to include in alignment [default: 75% of the median input sequence length]
param.name: min_length

param.label: -p/--min_percent_id: Minimum percent sequence identity to closest blast hit to include sequence in alignment [default: 0.75]
param.name: min_percent_id

tool.help:
This script aligns the sequences in a FASTA file to each other or to a template sequence alignment, depending on the method chosen. Currently, there are three methods which can be used by the user:
1. PyNAST 2. MUSCLE 3. INFERNAL
All aligners will output a fasta file containing the alignment and log file in the directory specified by --output_dir (default <alignment_method>_aligned). PyNAST additionally outputs a failures file, containing the sequences which failed to align. So the result of %prog will be up to three files, where the prefix of each file depends on the user supplied FASTA file:
1. "..._aligned.fasta" - This is a FASTA file containing all aligned sequences.
2. "..._failures.fasta" - This is a FASTA file containing all sequences which did not meet all the criteria specified. (PyNAST only)
3. "..._log.txt" - This is a log file containing information pertaining to the results obtained from a particular method (e.g. BLAST percent identity, etc.).
